snippet: Data from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services include payments and services connected with the 100 most common Medicare hospital stays.
abstract: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services data shows that prices charged by hospitals for variety of common procedures has increased over 10 percent from 2011 to 2013, while amounts paid by Medicare has not changed; rising prices are of most concern to those who are uninsured or those who are treated in hospitals not within their coverage network.

byline.original: By MARGOT SANGER-KATZ and KATIE THOMAS
byline.contributor: Griffin Palmer, Sarah Cohen and Reed Abelson contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Data from the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services include payments and services connected with the 100 most common Medicare hospital stays.

headline.main: Data Shows Large Rise in List Prices at Hospitals
headline.print_headline: Data Shows Large Rise in List Prices at Hospitals
